meanings.definition: A star performer, especially in a revue.
meanings.sent1: The vedettes captivated the audience with their dazzling performances.
meanings.sent2: The theater's vedettes received standing ovations every night.
meanings.sent3: The vedettes joked backstage, adding humor to their already impressive acts.
meanings.sent4: She shone on stage like a vedette in the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The vedettes' talent outshone all others in the show.

meanings.sent1: The vedettes stood guard at the entrance, watching for any intruders.
meanings.sent2: The vedettes patrolled the perimeter to ensure the safety of the outpost.
meanings.sent3: The vedettes shared stories to pass the time during their watch.
meanings.sent4: The lone vedette on duty felt like the protector of the entire area.
meanings.sent5: The vedettes' vigilance prevented any unauthorized entry.

meanings.definition: A small star or other luminous body.
meanings.sent1: The night sky was filled with countless vedettes twinkling above.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the movement of vedettes to understand the universe.
meanings.sent3: Children made a wish upon a falling vedette, believing it would come true.
meanings.sent4: Each vedette in the sky seemed to tell a story of its own.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the vedettes in the dark sky was mesmerizing.
